summary: Israel has been at the Olympic Games as a nation since 1952. Its National Olympic Committee was formed in 1933 during the British Mandate of Palestine.
full_text:
Israel has competed at the Olympic Games as a nation since 1952. Its National Olympic Committee was formed in 1933 during the British Mandate of Palestine. As the team represented the Jewish community, it boycotted the 1936 Games in Germany in protest of the Nazi Party's anti-Semitic policies.
Israel has sent a team to each Summer Olympic Games since 1952  and to each Winter Olympic Games since 1994.
In 1972, 11 members of the Israeli delegation were murdered by members of Black September Palestinian terrorist group.
title: Israel at the Olympics
